title: Sidon sequence
summary: In number theory, a Sidon sequence is a sequence A = { a 0 , a 1 , a 2 , … } {\displaystyle A=\{a_{0},a_{1},a_{2},\dots \}} of natural numbers in which all pairwise sums a i + a j {\displaystyle a_{i}+a_{j}} (for i ≤ j {\displaystyle i\leq j} ) are different. Sidon sequences are also called Sidon sets; they are named after the Hungarian mathematician Simon Sidon, who introduced the concept in his investigations of Fourier series.
